Job_Summary:
Ensure data quality: examine complex digital marketing data sets and identify the root cause of discrepancies.
Intermediate to Advanced proficiency with SQL.
Job_Description:
Our Marketing Teams at Best Buy Canada are home to some of the most creative and strategic thinkers in the industry who are committed to one goal: building lasting relationships with our customers.
Are you passionate about analytics and love telling stories with data? Are ingenuity, curiosity, and precision part of your professional DNA, and you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment? If yes, we are looking for someone like you to join the marketing analytics team.
As a Digital Marketing Analyst, you are an integral member of the marketing analytics team that empowers marketers to make faster and more informed decisions. You will work with analysts and specialists to provide actionable insights to executive leaders and business stakeholders in Retail, Digital and Media Network Marketing.
As a Digital Marketing Analyst, you will…
Contribute to strategic data automation projects that enable scalability and improve efficiency
Develop, implement, and maintain high-quality data tools to empower marketers to optimize campaign performance
Ensure data quality: examine complex digital marketing data sets and identify the root cause of discrepancies
Enable analytics and insights to help teams develop new advertising products on www.bestbuy.ca
Leverage predictive analytics and other modelling techniques
Work closely with business partners to promote a data-driven culture
Develop your analytics toolkit and learn
What you will need to succeed:
2+ years of experience in developing dashboards and tools using Business Intelligence tools (i.e. Power BI, Data Studio, Tableau, etc.)
Intermediate to Advanced proficiency with SQL
Practical knowledge of scripting languages like R or Python
Familiarity with predictive analytics and practical experience of building predictive analytics models
Proficiency with web analytics tools such as Adobe and/or Google Analytics
Strong Communication/Collaboration skills
Digital marketing analytics experience involving multi-channel campaign analytics
Bonus points…
Digital publisher or digital agency experience
Familiar with cloud tools and solutions (Azure, Big Query) used for data automation and predictive analytics
1+ year(s) experience working in an Agile environment; familiarity with JIRA, Confluence
We believe we have the unique opportunity to help customers enrich their lives and pursue their passions with the help of technology.

Job_Summary: Five or more years of directly related experience, preferably in the role of quality assurance analyst or tester (or equivalent).
Job_Description:
Competition Number S18520P

Position Title Quality Assurance Analyst

Position Number S99526

Employee Group Staff

Position Status Regular Full-Time

Start Date

End Date (if applicable)

Department IT Services

Additional Notes

Location North Vancouver

Working with us
At Capilano University, students are our focus. Employees play an essential role in creating an exceptional learning experience for students and a thriving campus community. Together, we are a high-performing team of individuals who make Capilano University one of the leading teaching universities in British Columbia and one of BC’s Top Employers. Grounded by our sense of purpose, we offer a meaningful, friendly and dynamic work environment.

As a member of the IT Services team, you will be instrumental in administering software quality assurance practices and principles throughout the software development life cycle, including requirements management, software design, coding, testing, and release management. You will be working with a variety of different groups in the IT Services team and will be leading the development of quality assurance testing procedures for enterprise and departmental applications projects, the automation of workflow and process testing procedures, the validation and verification of application testing, as well as the planning, design and execution of application testing. We are looking for someone to help us continue to build our software quality assurance practices and principles and exceptional experiences for our employee and student community. You will work with a team of talented IT professionals, an engaged community and an impactful executive team.

Do you share our purpose and passion?

What you’ll do
Provides quality assurance testing and validation services to ensure information systems programs and projects meet organization standards and end-user requirements.Defines, designs and articulates comprehensive and in-depth quality assurance strategies, approaches and plans for software projects. Advises project leads and administrators of QA effort required. Analyzes and reviews system features and requirements; participates in design reviews.Designs and creates test plans, scenarios and test cases, procures test data, executes test and documents results. Ensures sufficient breadth and depth of testing approach.Contributes to the development and maintenance of the QA framework, document templates for test plans and standards for QA testing.Champions quality assurance process improvements within IT Services.

What you’ll bring
Completion of a relevant Bachelor’s degree, preferably in the field of computer science / IT.Five or more years of directly related experience, preferably in the role of quality assurance analyst or tester (or equivalent). Experience writing use cases and test plans, testing criteria, and experience designing, developing and testing processes for enterprise data.

For more information
For more information, please see the complete job description.

Benefits
At Capilano University, we understand that there is more to life than work. That is why we offer comprehensive benefits and support to help you and your family live a balanced life.

Take a sneak peek to see what it is like to work at Capilano University.

Days and Hours of Work
Our standard work week is Monday to Friday, 8:30am – 4:00pm. This position may include evenings or weekends based on operational needs.

Bridge Period (if applicable)

Pay Group 28

Salary
$5,515 per month (with increments to a max of $6,205 per month)

Union MoveUP

Job Close Date 11/08/2020

Open Until Filled No

Job_Description: FORM (www.formswim.com) is a sports technology company with a simple mission: to break down the barriers between what swimming is and what it could be. We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our rapidly growing team.At FORM, you’ll help us write the rulebook on augmented reality in a new market. You’ll have the freedom to shape your role, how you own it, and how you grow with us. You’ll get to wear many hats, to coach, and to learn. And you’ll be part of an amazing and diverse group of people who love to work and play together.A Little Bit About UsFounded in 2016 in Vancouver, Canada, FORM is the sports technology company behind the FORM Swim Goggles, a pair of premium swim goggles with a see-through, augmented-reality display that delivers performance metrics in real time.Our founder and CEO, Dan Eisenhardt, swam competitively for 14 years before starting his career as a sports technology entrepreneur. His previous company, Recon Instruments, introduced the world’s first smart eyewear for sports in 2010 and was acquired by Intel in 2015. FORM employs many of the people from that original team, leveraging decades of combined expertise in sports-eyewear design, activity-tracking algorithms, and augmented-reality optics.To learn more, visit www.formswim.com.Position OverviewAs a member of the machine learning team, you’ll contribute to all aspects of FORM’s data pipeline. This includes conducting field trials to gather data, and organizing, analyzing, and drawing meaningful conclusions from collected data. Working closely with our engineering team, you’ll also make essential contributions to the development of our industry-leading wearable technology.To succeed in this role, you’ll need a thorough understanding of human body kinematics and experience with analyzing inertial measurement systems data for use in human activity recognition. You will have an advanced degree in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, or equivalent, specializing in algorithms, data science, or signal processing.Primary ResponsibilitiesDesign robust and lightweight algorithms for realtime deployment on wearable devicesUse machine learning techniques to perform research and analysis on inertial measurement systems dataAssist in designing and implementing experiments to collect inertial data from our product and prototypesDevelop DSP and ML-based algorithms and mathematical models that will generate meaningful insights for our usersPerform research in machine learning and apply this research to modern real-world problemsEvaluate applied products end-to-end to determine where and how to apply deep learning techniques and how to evaluate different approachesPresent experimental results and research findings clearly and concisely both internally and externallySoftware development in MATLAB, Python, etc.Critical interpretation and analysis of relevant academic papersApply the latest machine learning techniques to make on-the-fly conclusionsRequired Skills and QualificationsBackground in signal processing algorithms with demonstrated expertise in time-domain and frequency-domain discrete-time signal processing, ideally applied to human activity recognition problemsSolid understanding of the theory and practice of machine learning algorithms:Deep learningEnsemble techniquesExperience building functional prototype code in Matlab/Python/R and/or C/C++Industry experience or equivalent academic impact with focus on machine learning or signal processingA record of publishing papers in journals or conferences demonstrating contributions to your field of studyHands-on use of inertial measurement systemsWorking knowledge of statistical principles such as variability, bias, and noiseWell-versed in classification methods using machine learning of noisy dataHas worked with large data sets and is comfortable in at least one scripting language*Additional SkillsExperience in fast-paced, energetic startup environmentGreat communication and interpersonal skillsAbility to effectively multitask and wear many hatsEntrepreneurial spirit—self-starter and proactiveFlexible and adaptable to rapidly changing business conditions and prioritiesWe thank everyone who took the time to apply for this position, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.We’re daring, we’re focused, we’re human.We thank you for your interest in FORM and to everyone who took the time to apply for this position, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.FORM is committed to cultivating and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. We recognize that we are better able to achieve our goals and live our core values of being daring, focused and human, when we have a diverse team of employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment. We welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of your education, opinions, race, colour, place of origin, religion, family status, marital status, physical or mental disability, sex, age, sexual orientation, or political beliefs.*Job Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Casual dressCompany eventsDental careDisability insuranceDiscounted or free foodEmployee assistance programExtended health careFlexible scheduleLife insurancePaid time offStore discountVision careWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayExperience:human activity recognition using wearable sensors: 3 years (Preferred)Location:Vancouver, BC (Required)Work remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Job_Description:
Do you love using your data skills to find out how to make things run better? Use your skills to make our supply chain system more efficient, so we can use the savings to provide better health care across BC.

What you’ll do
Review, evaluate and recommend improvement and standardization of business processes.
Train staff on the functionality of business process and systems.
Develop and analyze key performance indicators. Identify needs and define system requirements, create project work plans and assist the team in system development, implementation, documentation, interfacing and maintenance.
Use large data sets to create data visualizations.
Orient and train users.
Develop and maintain reference documents such as workflow charts, user instructions, manuals and reference materials on business processes, policies and procedures.
What you bring
Graduation from a recognized degree or diploma program in Mathematics, Statistics, Business or a related Public Health field, three years’ recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Experience using data applications (i.e. Tableau, PowerBI and Sharepoint) and with data visualization, as well as having exposure to service design
You can/have:
Carry out business process mapping and fit gap analysis.
Communicate effectively verbally and in writing.
Proficient Microsoft Excel Skills.
Analyse data
Make data quality improvements
What’s in it for you

Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to more than 2,000 in-house training programs.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan.
12 annual statutory holidays with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
Flexible work options including flextime, work locations and job sharing (eligibility will vary)
Perks include onsite fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.
Job Type: Temporary Full Time until February 2021

What we do

Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) plans, manages and evaluates selected specialty and province-wide health care services across BC, working with the five geographic health authorities to deliver province-wide solutions that improve the health of British Columbians. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose. Learn more about PHSA and our programs: https://jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services

PHSA is committed to employment equity and hires on the basis of merit, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, backgrounds and experiences, and strive to create a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

Job_Summary: In collaboration with the HR Systems and Rewards Analyst complete annual audit of HRIS data to ensure data integrity is maintained and make recommendations for…
Job_Description:
WHY JOIN THE CANADIAN CANCER SOCIETY (CCS)?
As Canada’s largest national health charity, we fund the most promising cancer research, champion cancer prevention efforts and deliver programs and services that benefit Canadians affected by cancer. Join us and you can work with passionate and committed individuals from coast to coast who are working towards a world where no Canadian fears cancer.

To learn more about us, visit cancer.ca.

JOB OVERVIEW
Reporting to the Director, Human Resources, the Human Resources Coordinator is an integral part of the team and will provide administrative support for TeamPeople. This role will be responsible for assisting the onboarding and offboarding process, maintaining HRIS, payroll and data integrity and information management and employee experience support.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:
Provide support to business and HRBP’s in accurately completing employee status forms (ESF). Including the provision of organized and ongoing training to people leaders on completion of forms.
Add new hires, transfers, changes and departures to HRIS ensuring all steps are followed consistently and each record is accurate.
In collaboration with the HR Systems and Rewards Analyst complete annual audit of HRIS data to ensure data integrity is maintained and make recommendations for corrective action as appropriate.
Maintain electronic filing system and complete annual file audit.
Ensure data and records management processes are kept updated, implemented consistently and are compliant with applicable legislation.
Assist with onboarding by drafting employment agreements and sending new hire forms.
Assist with offboarding process by sending information including forms and checklist to people leaders and employees.
Maintain org charts using Visio and ensure updates are made on a monthly basis in line with payroll submission.
Maintain HR SharePoint site, mapping filing process in line with best practice and ensuring filing and naming conventions are maintained.
Draft verification of employment letters, promotion, transfer and change letters
Create milestone reports and support recognition of service process.
Works in compliance with Health and Safety regulations, and comply with the CCS's Health & Safety Policy.
Other duties as assigned.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
Completion of College diploma with a focus on HR or post-secondary degree is considered an asset.
1-3 years’ experience or combination of education and experience.
CPHR (or working towards) preferred.
High degree of integrity, ability to maintain confidentiality, discretion and good judgement.
Ability to remain focused and calm under high pressure situations working within tight timelines.
Exceptional attention to detail, accuracy and analytical skills.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Ability to work effectively as part of a geographically dispersed team, supporting employees across Canada.
Excellent communication skills including the ability to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles; communicate with technical and non-technical users.
Strong capabilities with core software including SharePoint, Microsoft Office suite, HRIS (ADP Workforce Now experience preferred).
Experience influencing decisions without having direct authority.
Experience working with payroll and addressing moderately complex issues.

WHAT WE OFFER:

CCS offers meaningful opportunities to make an impact in the fight against cancer. We are committed to fostering a culture that is inspiring, supportive and exemplifies our core values: CARING COURAGE INTEGRITY PROGRESSIVE.

In return for your skills and dedication, we offer an attractive compensation package that encompasses a competitive salary, excellent benefits and the opportunity to have a rewarding employment experience where your contributions can make a true difference every day.

HOW TO APPLY:
Qualified candidates are invited to submit their resume, cover letter and salary expectations by October 29, 2020.
For internal candidates, this position is assigned to salary band 3.

The Canadian Cancer Society is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. CCS will make available reasonable accommodations for people with disabilities upon request.

We thank all candidates for their interest and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Please note that in keeping with the mandate of the Canadian Cancer Society to model and promote healthy lifestyles, employees are not permitted to smoke in or about Society premises or while carrying out CCS business.

Job_Summary:
Can work with dashboarding software to visualize data reports.
Identify trends in the data, and proactively communicate them in a concise manner.
Job_Description:
The Opportunity
You Move Me is about vision, goals, growth, excitement and fun! Our innovative, results oriented organization is committed to helping you achieve your highest potential while maintaining a balance in your life. We are a new type of moving company, poised to revolutionize the $86B industry with a combination of cutting edge technology, amazing customer service and a team that is bent on making a difference for our customers and our Franchise Partners.
What people say about you:
I love analyzing numbers and data to uncover opportunities to drive the business forward
I have a unique ability to interpret complicated data and turn it into clear, concise and meaningful reports for different audiences.
I have a clear vision of the big picture but am also able to dive into details. I am a great listener and I also ask smart questions to get to the root of the problem and deliver solutions for key stakeholders in all areas of the business.
A day in the life:
Work with all areas of the business including marketing, finance, sales, and operations to organize, analyze and report on data
Design, develop, maintain and optimize reports and dashboards
Provide fact-based data-driven insights and analysis to formulate meaningful conclusions and recommendations
Create adhoc reports measuring the performance of strategic initiatives
Identify trends in the data, and proactively communicate them in a concise manner
Proactively identify additional key performance indicators to measure and support new business initiatives.
Develop and maintain forecast models
What you bring to the table:
Find enjoyment in converting high level information into granular detail, and then translating those details into clear business objectives
Experience working with and extracting data from APIs and understand popular programming languages such as Python, PHP, Java and NodeJS
Can work with dashboarding software to visualize data reports. Eg: Google Data Studio, Microsoft PowerBI
You understand the real world applications of the data you are analyzing and can communicate this to a range of stakeholders
Effective communicator and strong business acumen
Demonstrated ability to analyze and synthesize data and to formulate actionable insights
This is a hybrid work from home / office role. We are located downtown Vancouver near Waterfront Station.

Do you want this job now?
Tell us why you are awesome by submitting your resume and cover letter!

Job_Summary:
Familiarity with data analytics methodologies (or trends).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Data Studio.
Job_Description:
King Show Games Inc., a video game development company, is currently interviewing qualified applicants interested in pursuing a career in video game development. We are looking for people who are innovative, talented, creative, and passionate about the gaming industry. If you re a self-motivated team player who is able to multi-task and can handle the following responsibilities, we look forward to hearing from you!

Job Summary

The successful candidate will be an integral part of achieving data-driven decision making across all organizational functions. This person will report directly to the Data Analyst and will be responsible for supporting the Data Analyst in all areas of analysis and reporting.


Responsibilities

Work closely with the Data Analyst to help provide the required analysis to drive decision-making.
Generate actionable reports and recommendations to support decision-making.
Develop and evolve key performance indicators across all product platforms (desktop, mobile, tablet) and all business functions.
Work closely with the Product and Engineering Teams to configure, test and troubleshoot new feature development to ensure the appropriate analytics events are being captured.
Assist with the setup of automated marketing campaigns to target specific segments of users at specific times during the customer lifecycle.
Qualifications Required
BS in Mathematics, Information Management, Statistics or Economics (BS in Computer Science a plus).
At least 1 year of experience in a data-analytics role (preferably in an online business).
Strong SQL skills (MySQL preferred).
Advanced mathematical and statistical skills.
Proven ability to conceive and test theories; comfortable doing so by querying large and diverse data sets - can prove / disprove theories and opinions with data, analytics and dashboards.
Strong intellectual curiosity and ability to structure and solve difficult problems.
Familiarity with data analytics methodologies (or trends).
Candidates must have excellent organizational, communications (oral and written) and interpersonal skills.
Must be a self-motivated team player with the ability to work in a customer oriented, very fast-paced, and demanding environment.
Ability to bring projects to completion with minimal supervision.
Must be able to meet or exceed set project milestones and deadlines, which will entail extra work time as needed (work hours beyond a normal work week).

Bonus Attributes

Experience with Google Cloud, Bigquery and DeltaDNA.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Data Studio.
Experience with NoSQL (MongoDB preferred).
Familiarity with iOS, Android, or Facebook app marketplaces.

This job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive; it is intended to identify major responsibilities and requirements of the job. Team members may be requested to perform other job-related tasks and responsibilities other than those stated above.

About King Show Games

Founded in 1998, King Show Games is a Minnesota based company providing entertaining video games that are played around the world. Our growing company consists of talented artists, engineers, mathematicians and producers that have created over 200 games.


Our Company Belief consists of 4 principals:

THINK BIG – Think outside the box; strive to be successful.

BE FRANK – Be open and sincere in your dealings with others; be forthright.

FIGHT HARD – Believe in your ideas; speak up for your convictions.

After the call, MOVE AS A TEAM!

King Show Games offers competitive salaries and a full range of comprehensive benefits including a bonus plan, medical, dental, life and long-term disability insurance.

________________________________________________________________________________________

Candidates only apply. Recruiters please don't contact King Show Games.

Please, no phone calls about this job!

Please do not contact King Show Games about other services, products or commercial interests.

Canfor’s strength comes from the diversity of our skilled and resilient workforce. As our company continues to grow and diversify, so do our career opportunities. Let us take this opportunity to tell you how you could be the best fit for Canfor.

You’re a hardcore problem solver with an uncanny ability to see the forest for the trees. When it comes down it, you are a storyteller at heart. With your great communication skills, you’ll leverage your years of deep experience with analytics software to extrapolate raw data and lay it out in a way that paints a clear and concise story for the stakeholders involved. Analytics is your thing. That ability is what helps you recognize patterns and relationships within the data in front of you. You’ll show up armed with a degree in Business or Business Analytics and your advanced skills with the most up to date analytics tools at your disposal. Vancouver, BC

With one of Canada’s mildest climates, Vancouver is ideally suited for those devoted to outdoor pursuits, health and wellness. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. Job_Summary:
Performs data gathering and analysis for the Supply Chain function to facilitate operational activities.
Supports development and recommendation of procedures…
Job_Description:
Reporting to the Provincial Manager, Supply Chain Performance, the primary focus of the Data Analyst, Supply Chain Systems is to ensure that all supply chain and related applications are meeting the business needs of the organization, provide statistical performance reporting and application support for ERP Supply Chain modules. Responsibilities include systems analysis, design, development; implementation and maintenance of customized and delivered supply chain applications in addition to technical systems support services for Supply Chain staff and clients. The Data Analyst recommends improvement and standardization of business processes and ensures effective utilization of systems. This position is responsible for supply chain systems servicing all agencies, including training staff on the functionality of the systems. The Data Analyst works closely with the senior technical staff and leads responsible for the technical functions related to the applications.

What you'll do
Reviews systems use, identifies needs, and makes recommendations for reallocation or acquisition of systems or equipment to ensure appropriate utilization of computerized and manual systems as well as other departmental/divisional resources.
Participates in systems development and maintenance of the Supply Chain systems, including taking roles in developing and analyzing key performance indicators, needs identification, requirements definition, creating/ project work plans, and participate in system selection, development, implementation, documentation, interfacing and maintenance within established policies and guidelines in accordance with the Supply Chain strategic plan.
Provides recommendations for process improvement for the Supply Chain function and works with staff and managers to evaluate alternative procedural and systematic solutions which most effectively meet needs while maintaining acceptable business standards.
Supports report development based on needs of users including executive as well as agency management staff. Fulfils external reporting requirements as requested..
Performs data gathering and analysis for the Supply Chain function to facilitate operational activities
Maximizes systems functionality, integration and skill sets in user groups by analyzing processes using technological functionality and recommending/leading implementation efforts where appropriate.
Supports development and recommendation of procedures such as Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) standards to ensure security, integrity and accuracy of supply chain data.

We’re embarking on something BIG...
Central 1 is the partner of choice for financial, digital banking and payment products and services – fueling the success of businesses across Canada. With $16.9 billion in assets, we leverage our scale, strength and expertise to power progress for more than 225 credit unions and other financial institutions, enhancing the financial well-being of more than five million customers from coast to coast. For more information, visit Central1.com.

Because of COVID19, all Central 1 offices are currently closed to non-essential employees. This role will see you working remotely until our offices are reopened. The timeline to reopen is still under consideration, as are our future remote working policies.

Job Description

As a Data Reporting Analyst you will be responsible for supporting Central 1’s data analysis and reporting within the Application Management and Data function.
You will be building full analytical solutions and interpret data for use in the development of business strategies for our Credit Union clients.
What you'll do:
Design, develop, and enhance key algorithms
Follow a scientific experimental procedure, with lightweight documented hypotheses and outcomes
Use appropriate visualizations for a given metric or nature of data
Understand business needs and translate data into KPIs and actionable outcomes
Understand linkage between a variety of data sources
Maintain analytical solutions and collaborate to maintain our data lake
Perform research when required to understand a problem and present possible solution
Stay on top of the latest research in related areas, especially deep learning / artificial intelligence
Know enough about statistics and experimental design techniques to provide insights not originally known
Accepts full responsibility for individual performance, ensuring priorities are met, standards are followed

Develop and manage business intelligence solutions
 Developing BI recommendations based on stakeholder feedback, User experience (UX) interpretation of feedback

Defines and develops concise, standardized, and sharable metrics and dimensions to support initiatives
Tests new attributes that will be implemented onto the data warehouse and leverages across all business performance management solutions
Ensuring the right product is built

Bachelors degree or equivalent analytical experience required
 5+ years of experience in an analytical/data engineering role
5+ years’ experience in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Data Management or related field
Hands on experience supporting management reporting (i.e., Comparative Analysis, Financial Analytics, Predictive Modelling, Forecasting, etc.)
Advanced usage of Excel macros and program modules
2-4 years’ experience using Tableau
2-4 years Plotly/Dash user experience
2-4 years AWS

Experience with statistical analysis and modelling
Strong quantitative, analytical, problem solving, organizational and interpersonal skills
Excellent communication skills
Experience developing visualizations with BI tools (Tableau, Plotly/Dash or similar)
Proven ability to prepare, maintain and publish ETL documentation, including source-to-target mappings and business-driven transformation rules
Demonstrated attention to detail and maintaining high quality standards
Good analytical strategic mindset
Follows Quality Control standards
Has a sense of urgency for time sensitive materials
Working knowledge of Splunk
Additional Information

As much as we believe in working hard, we also believe in personal growth and taking time for ourselves. Accordingly, our total rewards philosophy amounts to one of the best compensation and benefits packages in the industry – from performance-based incentives and extended benefits, to training and education reimbursements and ample vacation time.
Central 1 is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce by creating an environment where everyone feels like they belong and has the opportunity to be successful. We are welcoming of all applicants and we will provide an accessible candidate experience.

Grade: E

THE DEPARTMENT
The mission of the Customer Department is to be the internal sales and service driver, representing our customer.

As a member of the Customer Department, you will be part of the team responsible for building and delivering on Aritzia’s Customer strategy to acquire, activate, retain, and reactivate customers. A commitment to quality and investing in results that add value and drive the business
A sense of urgency executing job responsibilities, prioritizing urgent and important work

Job_Description:
Requisition ID: 21208

Company
The City of Vancouver is striving to become the greenest city in the world, and a city powered entirely by renewable energy before 2050. We are proud to be one of BC's Top Employers, Canada's Best Diversity Employers, and one of Canada's Greenest Employers. With employees that have helped Vancouver consistently rank as one of the world's most livable cities, the City values a diverse workforce which represents the vibrant community we so proudly serve.
Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.


Main Purpose and Function
Using various research techniques, the Systems Analyst IA performs analytic work relating to studies of existing and proposed systems, procedures and methods in fleet management, parking enforcement and other related areas. These include feasibility studies, systems analysis and design, and methods and procedures studies. This position provides ongoing application support and responsibilities, and may include performing changes to business application configuration and programs.

This position has access to confidential files and information relating to and participates in the making of, a variety of recommendations for changes in methods and procedures of operations that may affect wage or salary rates, workloads, working conditions, promotional opportunities or reductions, changes or increases in employment.

Key Contacts and Reporting Relationships
The position reports to a Team Manager within Technology Services and works closely with Program and Project team members, external Vendors, Help Centre staff, business customers, and other IT partners. May supervise external consultants, and evaluate developers for project deliverables.

Specific Duties/Responsibilities
Acts as the project leader for moderately complex projects to implement computer systems and business process improvements of moderate cost and duration
May direct project staff and be responsible for project performance; provides technical, direction to programmers in junior technical staff, clients or consultants as the course of business requires
Acts as a consultant to business process owners, providing advanced support to meet business requirements, continuity of services and security of confidential data; consults with users in analyzing existing and proposed system procedures and requirements; provides impact assessments; recommends, designs and develops computer system solutions and applications for problems of varying complexity; prepares cost estimates and staff resource estimates
Evaluates or formulates recommendations which may affect wage/salary rates, workloads, working conditions, promotional opportunities and reductions/increases in staff
Evaluates need for, prepares detailed specifications for and writes new programs and revises existing programs using applicable software aids and languages
Manages and administers databases and data used by departmental staff; this could include advising staff on functionality, assisting staff to locate and extract needed data, developing appropriate queries and creating custom programs for more complex analysis needs
Prepares and maintains detailed user, systems and operations documentation; prepares and provides presentations, staff orientation, training & practical guidance on the use of new or changed computer systems and software
Assists in development of computer system standards for system support and maintenance of various business functions
Monitors & evaluates system usage and performance; implements improvements where appropriate
Troubleshoots and resolves technical problems that can’t be resolved by junior technical staff
Works with vendors to ensure service levels are met; if service breaks occur, facilitates speedy resolution and provides ongoing communication to department
Build reports using third party software tools
Trains department staff
Prepares test plans and data and conducts program and system testing and debugging; identifies need for additional testing
Keeps up-to-date with developments in programming techniques and languages, operating systems, database management software, computing hardware, the current state of the IT industry and industry trends, and related matters
Conducts technical and IT industry research; advises on industry trends, feasibility of technologies, products and technology alternatives relevant to the department
Other duties/responsibilities as assigned.


Minimum Qualification Requirements
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration or related field
Minimum of 5 years related experience
Minimum 5 years’ experience in developing and/or implementing business applications
Thorough working knowledge of office productivity tools (e.g. Windows, MS Office, MS Project, Visio, etc.)
ANSI SQL proficiency (T-SQL preferred)
Demonstrated operational and project management skills: results focused, team oriented.


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Knowledge of computer programming
Familiarity with object-oriented programming principles
Familiarity with reporting and BI tools (SQL Server Reporting Services preferred)
Familiarity with application development tools and standards as well as general programming principles and methodologies preferred
Experience with server technology and software preferred
Experience with system integration between business applications and across technical platforms preferred
Ability to analyze and interpret data and develop solutions
Ability to problem-solve
Ability to implement change
Ability to prepare reports in clear and non-technical language
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Combination of strong technical and business skills required
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as a member of a team
Excellent oral, written and presentation skills with ability to communicate to all levels of the organization
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure, manage multiple priorities and respond to requests in a timely manner

Working with us
At Capilano University, students are our focus. Employees play an essential role in creating an exceptional learning experience for students and a thriving campus community. Together, we are a high-performing team of individuals who make Capilano University one of the leading teaching universities in British Columbia and one of BC’s Top Employers. As a member of the IT Services team, you will be instrumental in administering software quality assurance practices and principles throughout the software development life cycle, including requirements management, software design, coding, testing, and release management. You will be working with a variety of different groups in the IT Services team and will be leading the development of quality assurance testing procedures for enterprise and departmental applications projects, the automation of workflow and process testing procedures, the validation and verification of application testing, as well as the planning, design and execution of application testing. We are looking for someone to help us continue to build our software quality assurance practices and principles and exceptional experiences for our employee and student community. Do you share our purpose and passion?

Advises project leads and administrators of QA effort required. Analyzes and reviews system features and requirements; participates in design reviews.Designs and creates test plans, scenarios and test cases, procures test data, executes test and documents results. Ensures sufficient breadth and depth of testing approach.Contributes to the development and maintenance of the QA framework, document templates for test plans and standards for QA testing.Champions quality assurance process improvements within IT Services.

What you’ll bring
Completion of a relevant Bachelor’s degree, preferably in the field of computer science / IT.Five or more years of directly related experience, preferably in the role of quality assurance analyst or tester (or equivalent). Experience writing use cases and test plans, testing criteria, and experience designing, developing and testing processes for enterprise data.

Job_Description: FORM (www.formswim.com) is a sports technology company with a simple mission: to break down the barriers between what swimming is and what it could be. We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our rapidly growing team.At FORM, you’ll help us write the rulebook on augmented reality in a new market. You’ll have the freedom to shape your role, how you own it, and how you grow with us. You’ll get to wear many hats, to coach, and to learn. And you’ll be part of an amazing and diverse group of people who love to work and play together.A Little Bit About UsFounded in 2016 in Vancouver, Canada, FORM is the sports technology company behind the FORM Swim Goggles, a pair of premium swim goggles with a see-through, augmented-reality display that delivers performance metrics in real time.Our founder and CEO, Dan Eisenhardt, swam competitively for 14 years before starting his career as a sports technology entrepreneur. His previous company, Recon Instruments, introduced the world’s first smart eyewear for sports in 2010 and was acquired by Intel in 2015. FORM employs many of the people from that original team, leveraging decades of combined expertise in sports-eyewear design, activity-tracking algorithms, and augmented-reality optics.To learn more, visit www.formswim.com.Position OverviewAs a member of the machine learning team, you’ll contribute to all aspects of FORM’s data pipeline. This includes conducting field trials to gather data, and organizing, analyzing, and drawing meaningful conclusions from collected data. Working closely with our engineering team, you’ll also make essential contributions to the development of our industry-leading wearable technology.To succeed in this role, you’ll need a thorough understanding of human body kinematics and experience with analyzing inertial measurement systems data for use in human activity recognition. You will have an advanced degree in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, or equivalent, specializing in algorithms, data science, or signal processing.Primary ResponsibilitiesDesign robust and lightweight algorithms for realtime deployment on wearable devicesUse machine learning techniques to perform research and analysis on inertial measurement systems dataAssist in designing and Job_Summary:
Familiarity with data analytics methodologies (or trends).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Data Studio.
Job_Description:
King Show Games Inc., a video game development company, is currently interviewing qualified applicants interested in pursuing a career in video game development. We are looking for people who are innovative, talented, creative, and passionate about the gaming industry. If you re a self-motivated team player who is able to multi-task and can handle the following responsibilities, we look forward to hearing from you!

Job Summary

The successful candidate will be an integral part of achieving data-driven decision making across all organizational functions. This person will report directly to the Data Analyst and will be responsible for supporting the Data Analyst in all areas of analysis and reporting.


Responsibilities

Work closely with the Data Analyst to help provide the required analysis to drive decision-making.
Generate actionable reports and recommendations to support decision-making.
Develop and evolve key performance indicators across all product platforms (desktop, mobile, tablet) and all business functions.
Work closely with the Product and Engineering Teams to configure, test and troubleshoot new feature development to ensure the appropriate analytics events are being captured.
Assist with the setup of automated marketing campaigns to target specific segments of users at specific times during the customer lifecycle.
Qualifications Required
BS in Mathematics, Information Management, Statistics or Economics (BS in Computer Science a plus).
At least 1 year of experience in a data-analytics role (preferably in an online business).
Strong SQL skills (MySQL preferred).
Advanced mathematical and statistical skills.
Proven ability to conceive and test theories; comfortable doing so by querying large and diverse data sets - can prove / disprove theories and opinions with data, analytics and dashboards.
Strong intellectual curiosity and ability to structure and solve difficult problems.
Familiarity with data analytics methodologies (or trends).
Candidates must have excellent organizational, communications (oral and written) and interpersonal skills.
Must be a self-motivated team player with the ability to work in a customer oriented, very fast-paced, and demanding environment.
Ability to bring projects to completion with minimal supervision.
Must be able to meet or exceed set project milestones and deadlines, which will entail extra work time as needed (work hours beyond a normal work week).

Bonus Attributes

Experience with Google Cloud, Bigquery and DeltaDNA.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Data Studio.
Experience with NoSQL (MongoDB preferred).
Familiarity with iOS, Android, or Facebook app marketplaces.

This job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive; it is intended to identify major responsibilities and requirements of the job. Team members may be requested to perform other job-related tasks and responsibilities other than those stated above.

About King Show Games

Founded in 1998, King Show Games is a Minnesota based company providing entertaining video games that are played around the world. Our growing company consists of talented artists, engineers, mathematicians and producers that have created over 200 games.


Our Company Belief consists of 4 principals:

THINK BIG – Think outside the box; strive to be successful.

BE FRANK – Be open and sincere in your dealings with others; be forthright.

FIGHT HARD – Believe in your ideas; speak up for your convictions.

After the call, MOVE AS A TEAM!

King Show Games offers competitive salaries and a full range of comprehensive benefits including a bonus plan, medical, dental, life and long-term disability insurance.

________________________________________________________________________________________

Candidates only apply. Recruiters please don't contact King Show Games.

Please, no phone calls about this job!

Please do not contact King Show Games about other services, products or commercial interests.

Job_Summary: In collaboration with the HR Systems and Rewards Analyst complete annual audit of HRIS data to ensure data integrity is maintained and make recommendations for…
Job_Description:
WHY JOIN THE CANADIAN CANCER SOCIETY (CCS)?
As Canada’s largest national health charity, we fund the most promising cancer research, champion cancer prevention efforts and deliver programs and services that benefit Canadians affected by cancer. Join us and you can work with passionate and committed individuals from coast to coast who are working towards a world where no Canadian fears cancer.

To learn more about us, visit cancer.ca.

JOB OVERVIEW
Reporting to the Director, Human Resources, the Human Resources Coordinator is an integral part of the team and will provide administrative support for TeamPeople. This role will be responsible for assisting the onboarding and offboarding process, maintaining HRIS, payroll and data integrity and information management and employee experience support.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:
Provide support to business and HRBP’s in accurately completing employee status forms (ESF). Including the provision of organized and ongoing training to people leaders on completion of forms.
Add new hires, transfers, changes and departures to HRIS ensuring all steps are followed consistently and each record is accurate.
In collaboration with the HR Systems and Rewards Analyst complete annual audit of HRIS data to ensure data integrity is maintained and make recommendations for corrective action as appropriate.
Maintain electronic filing system and complete annual file audit.
Ensure data and records management processes are kept updated, implemented consistently and are compliant with applicable legislation.
Assist with onboarding by drafting employment agreements and sending new hire forms.
Assist with offboarding process by sending information including forms and checklist to people leaders and employees.
Maintain org charts using Visio and ensure updates are made on a monthly basis in line with payroll submission.
Maintain HR SharePoint site, mapping filing process in line with best practice and ensuring filing and naming conventions are maintained.
Draft verification of employment letters, promotion, transfer and change letters
Create milestone reports and support recognition of service process.
Works in compliance with Health and Safety regulations, and comply with the CCS's Health & Safety Policy.
Other duties as assigned.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
Completion of College diploma with a focus on HR or post-secondary degree is considered an asset.
1-3 years’ experience or combination of education and experience.
CPHR (or working towards) preferred.
High degree of integrity, ability to maintain confidentiality, discretion and good judgement.
Ability to remain focused and calm under high pressure situations working within tight timelines.
Exceptional attention to detail, accuracy and analytical skills.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Ability to work effectively as part of a geographically dispersed team, supporting employees across Canada.
Excellent communication skills including the ability to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles; communicate with technical and non-technical users.
Strong capabilities with core software including SharePoint, Microsoft Office suite, HRIS (ADP Workforce Now experience preferred).
Experience influencing decisions without having direct authority.
Experience working with payroll and addressing moderately complex issues.

WHAT WE OFFER:

CCS offers meaningful opportunities to make an impact in the fight against cancer. We are committed to fostering a culture that is inspiring, supportive and exemplifies our core values: CARING COURAGE INTEGRITY PROGRESSIVE.

In return for your skills and dedication, we offer an attractive compensation package that encompasses a competitive salary, excellent benefits and the opportunity to have a rewarding employment experience where your contributions can make a true difference every day.

HOW TO APPLY:
Qualified candidates are invited to submit their resume, cover letter and salary expectations by October 29, 2020.
For internal candidates, this position is assigned to salary band 3.

The Canadian Cancer Society is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. CCS will make available reasonable accommodations for people with disabilities upon request.

We thank all candidates for their interest and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Please note that in keeping with the mandate of the Canadian Cancer Society to model and promote healthy lifestyles, employees are not permitted to smoke in or about Society premises or while carrying out CCS business.

Connect with us online
LinkedIn | Facebook | Twitter | YouTube

Job_Summary:
Performs data gathering and analysis for the Supply Chain function to facilitate operational activities.
Supports development and recommendation of procedures…
Job_Description:
Reporting to the Provincial Manager, Supply Chain Performance, the primary focus of the Data Analyst, Supply Chain Systems is to ensure that all supply chain and related applications are meeting the business needs of the organization, provide statistical performance reporting and application support for ERP Supply Chain modules. Responsibilities include systems analysis, design, development; implementation and maintenance of customized and delivered supply chain applications in addition to technical systems support services for Supply Chain staff and clients. The Data Analyst recommends improvement and standardization of business processes and ensures effective utilization of systems. This position is responsible for supply chain systems servicing all agencies, including training staff on the functionality of the systems. The Data Analyst works closely with the senior technical staff and leads responsible for the technical functions related to the applications.

What you'll do
Reviews systems use, identifies needs, and makes recommendations for reallocation or acquisition of systems or equipment to ensure appropriate utilization of computerized and manual systems as well as other departmental/divisional resources.
Participates in systems development and maintenance of the Supply Chain systems, including taking roles in developing and analyzing key performance indicators, needs identification, requirements definition, creating/ project work plans, and participate in system selection, development, implementation, documentation, interfacing and maintenance within established policies and guidelines in accordance with the Supply Chain strategic plan.
Provides recommendations for process improvement for the Supply Chain function and works with staff and managers to evaluate alternative procedural and systematic solutions which most effectively meet needs while maintaining acceptable business standards.
Supports report development based on needs of users including executive as well as agency management staff. Fulfils external reporting requirements as requested..
Performs data gathering and analysis for the Supply Chain function to facilitate operational activities
Maximizes systems functionality, integration and skill sets in user groups by analyzing processes using technological functionality and recommending/leading implementation efforts where appropriate.
Supports development and recommendation of procedures such as Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) standards to ensure security, integrity and accuracy of supply chain data.
Provides ongoing support and enhancement to all supply chain systems through training programs, one-on-one consultation, systems or procedural advice, specific problem resolution and troubleshooting, resolving or escalating system failures. Develops training materials required in providing customer support and user trainings.
Maintains application tables to keep them current and aligned with organizational needs.
Creates and maintains Business Resumption Plans and Disaster Recovery Plans.
Provides software support and maintenance by coordinating the set-up and installation of program with IM/IT.
Provides systems advice and expertise to areas external to the division having a significant supply chain systems impact.

What you bring
Graduation from a recognized degree or diploma program in a related field
Two (2) years recent related experience related to IT, Computer Science and/or Business Applications or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Ability to write programs in a variety of program languages
You can/have
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Ability to deal with others effectively.
Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
Ability to organize work.
What’s in it for you

Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to more than 2,000 in-house training programs.
12 annual statutory holidays with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
Flexible work options including flextime, work locations and job sharing (eligibility will vary)
Perks include onsite fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.
Job type Temporary Full Time unitil March 2021
Wage $35.29/Hour + 12.6% in lieu
Location 1795 Willingdon Avenue, Burnaby
Hours/ Days of work 0800-1600, Monday through Friday
Reference number 099612E

What we do


Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) plans, coordinates and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose. Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services

PHSA is committed to employment equity and hires on the basis of merit, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, backgrounds and experiences, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

Job_Summary:
Understand linkage between a variety of data sources.
Includes gathering business requirements, data mining all data sources, building prototypes and oversight…
Job_Description:
Company Description

We’re embarking on something BIG...
Central 1 is the partner of choice for financial, digital banking and payment products and services – fueling the success of businesses across Canada. With $16.9 billion in assets, we leverage our scale, strength and expertise to power progress for more than 225 credit unions and other financial institutions, enhancing the financial well-being of more than five million customers from coast to coast. For more information, visit Central1.com.

Because of COVID19, all Central 1 offices are currently closed to non-essential employees. This role will see you working remotely until our offices are reopened. The timeline to reopen is still under consideration, as are our future remote working policies.

Job Description

As a Data Reporting Analyst you will be responsible for supporting Central 1’s data analysis and reporting within the Application Management and Data function.
You will be building full analytical solutions and interpret data for use in the development of business strategies for our Credit Union clients.
What you'll do:
Design, develop, and enhance key algorithms
Follow a scientific experimental procedure, with lightweight documented hypotheses and outcomes
Use appropriate visualizations for a given metric or nature of data
Understand business needs and translate data into KPIs and actionable outcomes
Understand linkage between a variety of data sources
Maintain analytical solutions and collaborate to maintain our data lake
Perform research when required to understand a problem and present possible solution
Stay on top of the latest research in related areas, especially deep learning / artificial intelligence
Know enough about statistics and experimental design techniques to provide insights not originally known
Accepts full responsibility for individual performance, ensuring priorities are met, standards are followed
Accountable for Workstream planning process including inception, technical design, development, testing and delivery of BI solutions
Develop and manage business intelligence solutions
 Developing BI recommendations based on stakeholder feedback, User experience (UX) interpretation of feedback
 Designs descriptive and intuitive Business Intelligence capabilities in support of strategic priorities.
 Includes gathering business requirements, data mining all data sources, building prototypes and oversight of developing the solution and delivering the end product
Recommends ways to improve the efficiency and productivity of current BI solutions in order to be able to increase workload capacity
Defines and develops concise, standardized, and sharable metrics and dimensions to support initiatives
Tests new attributes that will be implemented onto the data warehouse and leverages across all business performance management solutions
Ensuring the right product is built

Qualifications

Who are you:
Bachelors degree or equivalent analytical experience required
 5+ years of experience in an analytical/data engineering role
5+ years’ experience in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Data Management or related field
Hands on experience supporting management reporting (i.e., Comparative Analysis, Financial Analytics, Predictive Modelling, Forecasting, etc.)
Advanced usage of Excel macros and program modules
2-4 years’ experience using Tableau
2-4 years Plotly/Dash user experience
2-4 years AWS
Strong understanding of database and business intelligence concepts
Experience with statistical analysis and modelling
Strong quantitative, analytical, problem solving, organizational and interpersonal skills
Excellent communication skills
Experience developing visualizations with BI tools (Tableau, Plotly/Dash or similar)
Proven ability to prepare, maintain and publish ETL documentation, including source-to-target mappings and business-driven transformation rules
Demonstrated attention to detail and maintaining high quality standards
Good analytical strategic mindset
Follows Quality Control standards
Has a sense of urgency for time sensitive materials
Working knowledge of Splunk
Additional Information

As much as we believe in working hard, we also believe in personal growth and taking time for ourselves. Accordingly, our total rewards philosophy amounts to one of the best compensation and benefits packages in the industry – from performance-based incentives and extended benefits, to training and education reimbursements and ample vacation time.
Central 1 is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce by creating an environment where everyone feels like they belong and has the opportunity to be successful. We are welcoming of all applicants and we will provide an accessible candidate experience.
Reporting to: Technical Product Director, Data Analytics
Grade: E
Internal Applicants must apply by: August 31, 2020
Date Posted: August 21, 2020

Job_Summary: Support the continuous development and coordination of our customer data strategy with cross-functional partners, as well as adhere to the highest data quality…
Job_Description:
THE DEPARTMENT
The mission of the Customer Department is to be the internal sales and service driver, representing our customer.
THE OPPORTUNITY
As a member of the Customer Department, you will be part of the team responsible for building and delivering on Aritzia’s Customer strategy to acquire, activate, retain, and reactivate customers. As the Senior Analyst, The Customer, you will support and coordinate activities to execute our customer data strategy within the department and cross-functionally. This role will act as the customer data steward to ensure we are capturing high quality data that provides ongoing value to our customers. You will develop and coordinate the ongoing governance of our customer data and work with cross-functional partners to ensure successful measurement and management of the program. And, with the skills you gain in this role, the opportunities are endless – from a rewarding career in the Customer Department, to continued growth and development with Aritzia.
THE JOB
As the Senior Analyst, The Customer, you will:
Provide accurate, timely, and trustworthy profile, preferences, behavior, and voice data of our customers
Support the continuous development and coordination of our customer data strategy with cross-functional partners, as well as adhere to the highest data quality standards when capturing data
Support the governance of data standards, policies, and processes based on internal and external factors
Collaborate with analytics and technology partners to understand data, deliver against our customer data strategy, and to ensure success measures are met
QUALIFICATIONS
The Senior Analyst, The Customer has:
A commitment to learn and apply Aritzia's Business and People Leadership principles
An ability to take on new opportunities and challenges, with a passion to continue to develop and grow oneself
A dedication to operational efficiency, investing in process and systems to improve team and business results
The intellectual and emotional intelligence to tactically partner cross-functionally in the pursuit of shared business outcomes
The skills to set clear objectives and hold oneself accountable to reach your full capability and maximize your capacity
Proven skills, education, and/or applicable certifications in the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and the appetite to continuously learn and develop oneself
A commitment to quality and investing in results that add value and drive the business
A sense of urgency executing job responsibilities, prioritizing urgent and important work
An ability to identify, evaluate, and suggest business opportunities for today and tomorrow, considering top line and bottom line impacts
ARITZIA
Head to our About Us for the scoop on who we are and what we do.
Aritzia is an Equal Opportunity employer. Aritzia believes in providing an inclusive workplace where all individuals have opportunity to succeed.
We are committed to doing so by providing accessible employment practices. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process and applicants are asked to make their accommodation needs known .

Position Type: Regular/Full-Time

Canfor’s strength comes from the diversity of our skilled and resilient workforce. As our company continues to grow and diversify, so do our career opportunities. Let us take this opportunity to tell you how you could be the best fit for Canfor.

You’re a hardcore problem solver with an uncanny ability to see the forest for the trees. You understand that sound business decisions are based on concrete data and you pride yourself on your ability to understand and disseminate that data in way that helps business move forward. If you found yourself nodding your head in agreement just now, this Sr. Analyst, People & Reporting role at our Vancouver, BC Head Office might just be your calling.

When it comes down it, you are a storyteller at heart. With your great communication skills, you’ll leverage your years of deep experience with analytics software to extrapolate raw data and lay it out in a way that paints a clear and concise story for the stakeholders involved. Analytics is your thing. That ability is what helps you recognize patterns and relationships within the data in front of you. Once you’ve acclimatized to the role and Canfor you’ll use your critical thinking abilities to anticipate HR and Payroll related challenges before they arise and be ready to bring your own ideas and creative solutions to the table.

You’ll show up armed with a degree in Business or Business Analytics and your advanced skills with the most up to date analytics tools at your disposal. Along with its endless supply of fresh air and clean water, Vancouver also boasts countless choices for culturally diverse, world-class cuisine and an inventory of arts and entertainment events. Job_Summary:
Work as a data analyst to provide information and insights to our stakeholders.
Uncovers and documents data lineages and transformations across source systems…
Job_Description:
We’re looking for a spectacular Data Analyst to join our Data & Analytics team, to work across all business areas at Unbounce (Revenue, Product, and Operations). You’d support data-driven decision-making and ensure that high quality data is available for the organization’s consumption.
Our goal in our team is to use decision science to move the business towards a unified strategy, in a way that minimizes time spent on low-impact analysis and maximizes high-impact, data-driven decisions. The team strives to aid all business departments in their quest to create world-class customer products, and to increase market value for the business. The Data & Analytics team uses a combination of statistics, analysis and business intelligence, machine learning, and data science to answer business questions and deliver insight and recommendations for internal stakeholders.
The Analyst, Data Governance will develop, support and continually improve a data governance program, and identify and address priority data quality issues. They will enhance data management practices throughout the data lifecycle and are instrumental in improving the reliability of our data assets.

What You'll be Doing:
Work as a data analyst to provide information and insights to our stakeholders.
Proactively work with stakeholders to formulate and manage business questions, hypotheses, and specifications.
Contribute to the development and day-to-day operations of a data governance program and support data stakeholders including Data Governance Working Groups
Uncovers and documents data lineages and transformations across source systems and into data reporting repositories and improves the reliability and accuracy of data assets
Proactively elicits data quality issues, identifying and documenting root causes and recommendations to promote data accuracy across the organisation.
Work as an integral part of our ‘Data Analyst Chapter’ and Data Organization by contributing to the overall data ecosystem and improving data literacy throughout Unbounce
Help identify, define and build metrics and KPIs that lead to actionable results
Instrument applications with user tracking analytics to gain insight into the customer journey and how our product features are being used
Communicate complex quantitative data stories in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
Breakdown stakeholder asks and suggest solutions based on timeliness, accuracy, business value, and impact
Be comfortable being the ‘go-to’ data person for your projects
Stay up to date on industry standards and best practices in data analytics
Own building hypotheses, scoping, running and conducting post analysis of experiments & A/B tests

A Little Bit About You
You have 2+ years working as an analyst, with a proven track record of generating research and analysis in a repeatable and actionable manner
You excel at working with non-technical stakeholders to help translate, manage and drive business needs into actionable insights
You’re familiar with project management, or have worked with a scrum master/product owner: managing and prioritizing tasks across teams (we use agile ceremonies, and JIRA to track our work), knowing who to loop in when, and providing timely updates to your stakeholders
You have a great working understanding of data governance practices and ideas of how to improve data literacy for non technical audiences
You have a working knowledge of data modelling, warehousing, and pipelining. We currently use Airflow to schedule our jobs
You are comfortable with SQL (we use mySQL and Postgres dialects) (experience using Python would be a bonus)
You are an expert data storyteller and have experience with a set of tools to enable that.

What’s in it for You:
A remote friendly office with flexible hours - for this role we will consider all applications from those based in Canada with the option to work from our Vancouver office
4 weeks vacation plus Christmas Holiday Closure - you're entitled to the week of Christmas off with pay through to and including Jan 1st
Vacation bonus - $1,000.00
12 Personal Wellness Days (This includes: Personal day, Moving day, Sick day, etc)
Health and Wellness budget - $500.00
Networking budget - $500.00
A paid day off for your birthday
One paid Volunteer day per year
One day every 2 weeks of dedicated professional development time

Unbounce Welcomes Everyone to Apply
At Unbounce we celebrate everyone and their multiple intersecting identities. We believe a panorama of experience allows us to make better decisions together and inspires innovation so that we can better serve our customers and community. Our goal is for every Unbouncer to feel deeply connected to their team through mutual value, respect, and understanding.
Please let us know if you require any accommodations or support during the recruitment process
